blogs.title: Understanding Your Symptoms: How Our AI Symptom Checker Can Help
blogs.description: Feeling unwell but not sure what's wrong? Learn how our intelligent AI symptom checker analyzes your symptoms to provide potential insights and guide you on your next steps towards getting the right medical attention.

blogs.title: Navigating Common Cold vs. Flu: A Guide Using Our AI Disease Information
blogs.description: Is it just a common cold or something more serious like the flu? This post breaks down the differentiating symptoms and explains how our AI-powered disease information can help you understand the nuances and when to seek professional advice.
blogs.image: Green Illustrative Cough and Sneezes Spread Diseases School Poster.png

blogs.title: The Future of Finding a Doctor: AI-Powered Doctor Matching
blogs.description: Tired of endless searches for the right doctor? Discover how our AI algorithm helps you find doctors based on your specific needs, symptoms, and our comprehensive disease database, making healthcare more accessible and personalized.
blogs.image: blue find doctor modern instagram post.jpg

blogs.title: Understanding Migraines: Causes, Symptoms, and When to Consult a Doctor
blogs.description: Migraines are more than just headaches. This blog post delves into the common causes, varying symptoms of migraines, and how our AI symptom checker can assist in identifying potential triggers, while also emphasizing when it's crucial to consult a healthcare professional for diagnosis and treatment.
blogs.image: Blue Modern Online Doctor Consultation Instagram Post.jpg

symptoms.symptoms: water in eyes, irritation in eyes
irritation in eyes, water in eyes

results.advice: Please consult a general physician if symptoms persist.

results.enteredSymptoms: water in eyes, irritation in eyes
results.advice: Based on the symptoms reported (watery eyes and irritation), a variety of conditions could be the cause. It is important to determine the specific cause for effective treatment. Avoid rubbing your eyes, as this can worsen irritation and potentially spread infection. If symptoms persist or worsen, or if you experience vision changes, pain, or light sensitivity, seek prompt medical attention.
recommendedActions: Consult an eye doctor (ophthalmologist or optometrist) if symptoms worsen or persist beyond a few days.

results.enteredSymptoms: irritation in eyes, water in eyes
results.advice: The symptoms described (eye irritation and watery eyes) can be caused by various conditions. It is important to determine the exact cause to provide appropriate treatment. While some causes are mild and self-limiting, others require medical attention to prevent complications. Avoid rubbing your eyes, as this can worsen the irritation and potentially introduce bacteria. It is recommended to seek professional medical advice from an eye doctor (ophthalmologist or optometrist) for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.
recommendedActions: Consult an ophthalmologist or optometrist for a comprehensive eye exam
Use artificial tears (over-the-counter) for temporary relief of dryness and irritation
Wash your hands frequently to prevent the spread of potential infection
If you suspect a chemical exposure, flush your eyes with copious amounts of clean water for at least 15 minutes and seek immediate medical attention
Remove contact lenses if you wear them and do not reinsert them until evaluated by a doctor.

results.advice: Based on the reported symptoms of eye infection and watery eyes, a proper diagnosis requires a physical examination by a medical professional. Do not self-treat. The possibilities range from mild to potentially sight-threatening. Avoid touching your eyes and practice good hygiene to prevent spread of infection.
recommendedActions: Consult an ophthalmologist or general practitioner for a thorough eye examination
Wash hands frequently with soap and water
Discontinue contact lens wear if applicable
Use a clean, damp cloth to gently clean any discharge around the eyes
